data.text:
Globally, 43% of schools lack basic handwashing facilities with soap & water — key elements for fighting #COVID19.

New @WHO & @UNICEF guidelines outline infection prevention measures needed to ensure schools can reopen & operate safely. https://t.co/fXBqnYBlgl https://t.co/1ufHkDjPqp

Starting soon: Virtual UN Chamber Music Society concert in support of Lebanon’s ongoing relief and recovery efforts after the catastrophic explosions in #Beirut. Watch here: https://t.co/KzNqyJScXV https://t.co/Apx57z7VbW

Misinformation is designed to manipulate your emotions & trick you into passing it on. 

Pause — take a breath and be mindful about what you share. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare

https://t.co/WdwMDqm3c1 https://t.co/vgr8liXdfb

Umra Omar is one of the real life heroes dedicating their lives to helping others amid #COVID19. She provides free medical care with a mobile unit in Kenya, where 70% of the population lives in remote areas.

Read her story ahead of #WorldHumanitarianDay. https://t.co/6y2GuUcRO2

6 months ago, Africa confirmed its first case of #COVID19. Since then, there have been 1 million cases, affecting every country on the continent.

From nurses to virologists, meet some of the health heroes leading Africa's pandemic response: https://t.co/vEzXwkXbPf via @WHOAFRO https://t.co/34nEZvU5em

Pests and diseases destroy up to 40% of food crops every year.

During the International Year of #PlantHealth, we can all inspire change & raise awareness about the importance of healthy plants! https://t.co/33mSYgEmEz via @FAO #IYPH2020 https://t.co/plDk4e3xVf

Lebanon: @UN_Women is providing protection and psychosocial assistance to women & girls affected by the catastrophic explosions in #Beirut.

They are also supporting efforts to encourage women's involvement in recovery plans.
https://t.co/LWzRsd1rww

Misinformation is spreading faster than #COVID19 itself, and is designed to exploit our emotions and biases.

So PAUSE, and take time to verify facts before you share something online. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare

https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/ZxPh29rJdP

Find hope in acts of kindness from people all over the world who are coming together to support each other during the #COVID19 pandemic.

Get inspired with this @Twitter moment 👇

https://t.co/NLR5DESRkN

Nearly 100 UN peacekeepers working with @UNIFIL_ have donated blood for the victims of last week's devastating explosions in #Beirut.

Learn about how the @UNPeacekeeping mission is helping the Lebanese people & supporting recovery efforts.

https://t.co/3OIusJPKr4

Once local transmission of #COVID19 is under control, getting students back into schools as safely as possible must be a top priority.

We need education more than ever.  

-- @antonioguterres calls for inclusive, resilient & quality education systems. https://t.co/OZLqn8jqE9 https://t.co/ZctZLj3wYe

Communities across the Pacific are standing in solidarity against #COVID19.

Tune in to the virtual #PacificUnite concert and show your support for countries in the region during the pandemic. https://t.co/WhwXXmUzNN via @UN_Pasifika https://t.co/Z1puLbieaE

#COVID19 poses unique risks to the elderly & disabled.

Improving care systems & leveraging technology to reduce isolation are just a few ways to support some of the world's most vulnerable people amid the crisis. via @WorldBank

https://t.co/IVTAaHnugT

Artists from around the Pacific are coming together this weekend to pay tribute to essential workers & support everyone's contribution in fighting #COVID19.

More details about the #PacificUnite concert ⬇️
https://t.co/ExkP6H0nfx

"Poverty is one of the strongest things I'm concerned about, because I know how it feels to grow up in poverty."

In this episode of our Awake At Night podcast, @ZainabHawa talks to @MelissaFleming about what motivated her to devote her life to others. 🔊 https://t.co/T3cMhfWDt3 https://t.co/IRN5hocBET

The destruction of the #Beirut port has put millions of people in Lebanon at risk of food insecurity.

@WFP is working around the clock to avoid a humanitarian catastrophe in the country. https://t.co/2MyBIqzZ7g https://t.co/lqYQTzSp84

"We're here. We will support you. Just let us know. Don't be afraid."

-- @ZainabHawa with a message of support for those experiencing gender-based violence, which has increased during the #COVID19 pandemic.

Get details & resources from @UN_Women: https://t.co/WajNc2iVkE https://t.co/AHB0RqbLXN

Amid economic collapse, #COVID19 and the catastrophic explosions in #Beirut, @UNICEF is supporting children in Lebanon by providing medical supplies, water, psychological support & more.

Support their efforts here: https://t.co/rVqGp7BhmA

https://t.co/7swy37pesG

Masks can help keep us safe from #COVID19, along with:

📍 physical distancing
🧴 handwashing
👥👥 avoiding crowds
🤧 covering your mouth & nose when coughing

More from @WHO on how to #WearAMask & help prevent the spread of #coronavirus: https://t.co/doHQ5dLJ3J

75 years after atomic bombings of Hiroshima & Nagasaki and 50 years after entry into force of Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty, renewed efforts needed to achieve world free of nuclear weapons, top UN officials say in Conference on Disarmament.

https://t.co/2pnWRQN6ms

#FoodSafety should always be a priority, including during the #COVID19 pandemic.

Separate raw meat & cooked food 🥩
Keep your hands clean 🧼
Cook meat thoroughly 🥪
Store food safely 🥬

More from @WFP. https://t.co/3EoYwBSfkf https://t.co/4fX74N5a3c

https://t.co/4eKzntyEg3

From medical equipment to humanitarian aid, the UN continues to deliver life-saving support to those in need amid the #COVID19 pandemic.

See how we're helping, in this new @Twitter moment. https://t.co/IlzBX3QDou

"We all came down - hand in hand and united - Syrians, Lebanese and Palestinians, so we can help."

Refugees & other communities have come together to support people affected by the devastating #Beirut explosions. https://t.co/3O3u4sf1Ux via @Refugees https://t.co/bmfYCXT7Fd

Physical distancing does not have to mean social or emotional isolation.

Connect with your loved ones. We are in this together -- and we will get through this together.

🎨: Leyah Mirza https://t.co/iBnpuokxKf

Among the 2 million people who live in Gaza, there have only been 80 confirmed cases of #COVID19. Therefore, @UNRWA was able to reopen schools this week, allowing 280,000+ students to return to the classroom.

More on how UNRWA supports Palestine refugees: https://t.co/BKsOQYKW7A https://t.co/YBZBC1HYNR

17 tonnes of personal protective equipment, provided by @WHO, have arrived in #Beirut. 

The supplies will help protect health workers treating patients of last week's devastating explosion from #COVID19. https://t.co/lxf9wRMm71 via @WHOEMRO https://t.co/WlNtcyvFt6

After having been severely disrupted by #COVID19, polio vaccination campaigns have resumed in Afghanistan and Pakistan, the last two polio-endemic countries in the world. Get details from @UNICEF:
https://t.co/smq8YurQTC
See how youth engagement for global action was celebrated around the world on Wednesday's #YouthDay in this @Twitter moment. https://t.co/9FLkUus3Gw

The world is looking to all leaders to address this epic crisis in ways that make a concrete, meaningful and positive contribution to the lives of people.   
It is our responsibility to deliver.   

-- @antonioguterres tells Security Council. https://t.co/8OFYeVdpVz #COVID19 https://t.co/JXXX5rNOzu

https://t.co/kNn0RD7Ftj #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/HznsppC4D3

"Realizing the promise of this generation means investing far more in young people’s inclusion, participation, organizations and initiatives."

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's #YouthDay. https://t.co/hwqYUZ9ZCV https://t.co/zQFbZ1WSZI

Elephants are vital to our ecosystem, yet, their population is declining by almost 8% every year.

On Wednesday's #WorldElephantDay, test your knowledge about 🐘🐘 & go #WildforLife on a savannah journey! via @UNEP https://t.co/Qzu5qktb0O

On Wednesday's #YouthDay and throughout August follow #31DaysofYOUth to celebrate 1.8 billion young people around the world and their contributions to a better future for all. https://t.co/XtFZUavDRy via @UNYouthEnvoy https://t.co/U0lFKEiAWd

✅ Taking #ClimateAction
✅ Reducing inequalities

The #COVID19 pandemic requires an intergenerational response in the present and future. 

On Wednesday's #YouthDay, thank the young women and men working hard to support their communities. https://t.co/jFoI7je00m via @UN_Women  #GenerationEquality https://t.co/PScF8lrzSQ

The #coronavirus crisis poses particular challenges for young people. Their perspectives and ideas are essential to the #COVID19 response and to build a better future. 

On Wednesday's #YouthDay & every day, let's make sure young people's voices are heard. https://t.co/a71ydMZKER https://t.co/5JgnWPbnGV

We need to support people's basic incomes - because this is a crisis that is going to last. 

-- @eclac_un chief @aliciabarcena on why she hopes the #COVID19 pandemic will be a wake up call to address the growing poverty and inequality in Latin America & the Caribbean. https://t.co/k4o2ii3LD1

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds.

No act of goodwill is too small in the fight against #coronavirus. https://t.co/nWVbaf5ujr via @UN_Women https://t.co/agIVhzB4S9

This year, 1 in every 45 people on the planet will need humanitarian assistance, and most of that assistance will be coordinated through the UN.

Although the humanitarian challenges continue to grow, so does the commitment of humanitarians.   https://t.co/Z1mKcW36cl  

#UN75 https://t.co/MEaIqnihh2

Lion populations have dropped by more than 40% in the last two decades.

On Monday's #WorldLionDay, see how @UNEP works to protect our ecosystems. https://t.co/kv0mWsWtr2 https://t.co/o1vKioAgUH
